COPING WITH A CRISIS
March 26 from 12:30 to 1 pm
This webinar is presented as part of our 2020 monthly educational series for families and caregivers. This timely edition will help families to cope with our current situation, as well with the many common crises families often experience.

Most families will experience a crisis (illness, loss, natural disaster, etc.) at some point. Whether it is a situation that impacts just your family or something impacting the entire community, families are affected in many ways. This webinar will provide the knowledge and tools to promote whole family wellness during a time of crisis: recognition of stress indicators, the development of coping strategies and positive communication.

post_text: Congratulations to our outstanding Lady Lions who competed this weekend at the Ocean Breeze Athletic Complex on Staten Island in the NYSPHSAA Indoor Track and Field Championship Meet. Kahniya James set a new Section VI record in the 55m dash with a photo finish for 2nd in NY. Her time of 6.950 ties her for 4th in the United States! Sydney Nowicki competed in two events at the meet. She finished 5th in NY (6th Federation) in the 1000m, clocking a new school record time of 2:55.53. Sydney finished 23rd in the 1500m. Skylar Pointer threw 34'9" to finish 19th in the Shot Put.

post_text: On Saturday, at the Section VI Indoor Track & Field Championships, 3 Lockport athletes qualified for the NYSPHSAA Indoor State Championship. Kahniya James set a new Section VI record in the 55m dash - 7.02, which ties her for #1 in NYS and #7 in the USA. Sydney Nowicki won the 1000m run in 2:55.88, #11 in NYS. She also qualified in the 1500m with a 2nd place finish (5:00.30). Skylar Pointer will compete in shot put at the state meet after she finished 3rd at 35-08. She also placed 4th in the weight throw. Other top performers for the Lions were Collin Thompson, finishing 4th in the 55m dash (6.72). The girls 4x200m Relay of Michaela Kurbs, Aaliyah Lee, Jasmine White, and Kahniya James placed 3rd in 1:49.87, a new school record. Congratulations to all!

post_text: The cross country teams competed Saturday in the Section 7 Pre-State Invitational at SUNY Plattsburgh. The girls finished 7th and the boys finished 4th. Strong performances from the Lady Lions came from Sydney Nowicki finishing 2nd. Emma Cain 33rd, Katie Strobel 49th, and Kennedy Doran 54th. Jordan White, Meg Samuelson, Avery Connor, and Jay Gilbert rounded out the effort. Owen White's 15th place finish led a close boys squad to the top 4 finish. Jackson Doran 18th and Lucas Powley 24th worked to pace off of White. Sophomores Kenny Currie and Jesse Nowicki each had outstanding races and finished 29th and 30th. Their close finish kept the compression split (1-5 runners times) down to 41 seconds. Josh Ferraro, Colin Connolly, and Andrew Hildreth all had strong performances for Lions in their first 5k efforts of the season.
